name: Anthropology of Media and Publics
description: How do media work to circulate texts, images, and stories? Do media create unified publics? How is the communicative process of media culturally-distinct? This course examines how anthropologists have studied communication that occurs through traditional and new media. Ethnographic examples drawn from several contexts.Same as MDSC53H3
prerequisites: [ANTB19H3 and ANTB20H3] or [MDSA01H3 and MDSB05H3 and ACMB01H3]
